question: Which among the following may not be called a consequence of 1857 revolts?
option1: European Troops were increased in India
option2: Different Classes of Sepoys were mixed
option4: Hindu’s & Muslims began to be appeased equally
answer: Hindu’s & Muslims began to be appeased equally
explanation: After the Great revolt of 1857, the number of European troops were increased in India to suppress any further seditious activities. Sepoys from different class were mixed. During the time of the revolt of 1857, the Hindus and Muslims of India mobilized to fight the British for very short period of time. Very soon they were separated again.
